page.title: 13EDWARD VII CHEST HOSPITAL.
page.content: A memorial to the king it was built high on Hartford Hill over- looking Warwick in 1923 as a sanatorium for tuberculosis patients. Any surgery was carried out in Warwick.Later a small theatre was built on site.Surgery for T.B. became less common but other ailments were treated especially cancer.In the 60's a heart unit was started.A machine made by Melrose was used to pump blood.Heart surgery patients were given a rosebud as they went into the theatre and it was put by their locker so that it was the first thing they saw when they came round.Hence the nickname'the Hospital of the Rose'.At one time there were about l75 beds.As other hospitals opened in Warwickshire the number of patients fell and in l983 it became a geriatric hospital with 56 beds.Beautiful view from front
